Posted By: Kryptnyt (5/10/2010 3:39:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I had to do a double take when I first saw one of these lying around... Let's see... A 5/5 for 4BB. Okay, it had better be useful. Sac a creature when it comes into play... Oh, boy... this thing had better have some amazing abilities! Can't be blocked by Saprolings... HUH?!?!?! Shouldn't it have Fear or something to justify the name and the absurd cost?!
  
   
I have no idea what they were on when they made this card? A 5/5 for 4BB that can't be blocked by Saprolings is basically a Craw Wurm - why does it need to sac a creature, too? And who cares about Saprolings? And isn't a 5/5 large enough to handle Saprolings that are almost always 1/1's? And how does this card make any sense at all? Plants fleeing the angry mob? A mob that wants to hunt down plants? Huh?!
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Maybe it's better that not all cards are on the same level power as Visara but I agree that [Vindictive Mob](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindictive Mob) is crap. Overcosted for what it does and protection from Saprolings isn't very useful (personally I like to get rid of creatures via [Deathspore Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathspore Thallid)).  
And why this card is an uncommon is also very stupid.

posts.post_content:
Magic kinda needs bad cards though... it adds an element of luck and skill to formats like draft and sealed, and balances he game  
  
for example, if i'm running a nice green and black deck in a ravnica draft, and if this is one of the best black cards left that i need to make a complete deck, then i'll use it. Especially if i have some good dredge cards and no big things, this is going in, and maybe my opponent won't chump block with saprolings all day long because of it.
